Daniel Schifano

Using stakeholder alignment to drive change

Product Lead - Vitamin Shoppe - 2017

At Rangle we work with large enterprise clients often. During this engagement I was tasked with facilitating a design sprint to help internal client stakeholders gain alignment amongst themselves.

Some activities included defining the project goals, key internal stakeholders, key target end-users and developing a story map.

Using our findings to push development forward

Once we identified what the project goal was and who are key end-users were we began the story mapping process.

This allows us to plan what features we want to build first depending on their priority. Anything that we miss or is a “nice to have” will be picked up in a future release.

The goal of this exercise is to create micro-releases for your product that incorporate the highest priority features so that you can get to market much faster and with less risk.
